intro: Limodorum villosum, commonly known as the hairy lily of the valley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its dense, upright clumps of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, blooming in late spring to early summer. Limodorum villosum thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
